IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE MISSION OF GREAT CIRCLE IS TO RESHAPE VULNERABLE LIVES THROUGH A COMMUNITY OF PARTNERS, TEACHERS AND LEADERS, GIVING CHILDREN AND FAMILIES THE CONFIDENCE TO CREATE BRIGHT FUTURES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE MISSION OF GREAT CIRCLE IS TO RESHAPE VULNERABLE LIVES THROUGH A COMMUNITY OF PARTNERS, TEACHERS AND LEADERS, GIVING CHILDREN AND FAMILIES THE CONFIDENCE TO CREATE BRIGHT FUTURES.
IRS990.Description: PROVIDE SPECIALIZED TREATMENT SERVICES FOR TROUBLED BOYS AND GIRLS BETWEEN THE AGES OF 6 AND 21 THROUGH RESIDENTIAL TREATMENT, INDIVIDUALIZED EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS. THE RESIDENTIAL PROGRAMS SERVED 556 CHILDREN. OVERALL, APPROXIMATELY 8,514 FAMILIES WERE SERVED.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION HIRED THIRD PARTY PROFESSIONALS TO ADVOCATE FOR CHILDREN'S PROGRAMS WITH THE MISSOURI LEGISLATURE.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S PERMANENT ENDOWMENT HAS BEEN RESTRICTED BY THE DONOR SUCH THAT INCOME EARNED BY THE ENDOWMENT MAY BE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

The Organization constitutes a qualified not-for-profit organization under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and is, therefore, exempt from federal income taxes. The Organization's (federal and state) tax returns for tax years 2007 and later remain subject to examination by taxing authorities.

OTHER CHANGES ARE COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING: CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN PERPETUAL TRUSTS 163,732 PENSION PLAN CHANGE OTHER THAN NET PERIODIC BENEFIT COST 86,618 CHANGE IN CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE 1,740 ELIMINATION OF INTEROFFICE CHARGES 255,714 ------- 507,804

THE OTHER CHANGES IN NET ASSETS ARE COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING: UNREALIZED GAINS/LOSSES $495,289 CHANGE IN CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE $1,740 CHANGE IN VALUE BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUST $163,732 CHANGE IN PENSION PLAN $86,618 --------- TOTAL $747,379
OTHER CHANGES ARE COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING: ELIMINATION OF INTEROFFICE CHARGES 255,714 ------- 255,714

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: REVIEW OF THE 990 BY THE GOVERNING BODY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE PRIOR TO FILING. THE 990 WAS ALSO DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: MONITORSHIP & ENFORCEMENT OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLICANCE WITH THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BY REQUIRING ALL SUPERVISORS, MANAGEMENT, OFFICERS, BOARD MEMBERS, AND TRUSTEES TO ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT REGARDING ALL INTERESTS THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS. THESE SIGNED FORMS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE NOMINATING COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS THAT SHOULD BE REPORTED/DISCUSSED BY THE BOARD.

THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND CEO AND OTHER OFFICERS INCLUDES COMPARING SALARIES TO THE MARKET IN THE SURROUNDING AREA. THE COMPENSATION OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND IS APPROVED BY THE BOARD CHAIR ANNUALLY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: AVAILABILITY OF INFORMATION TO THE PUBLIC
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.

An officer received a secured loan for the purposes of relocation to another town in 2008 as part of a change in the employee's principal place of work. The loan does not bear interest and is described in Treasury Regulation Section 1.7872-5 as exempt from imputed interest income and imputed mortgage interest expense calculations for tax purposes. For financial statement purposes, the amount of the loan is net of projected imputed interest over the term of the loan.

THE OTHER CHANGES IN NET ASSETS IS COMPOSED OF THE FOLLOWING: UNREALIZED GAINS 495,289 CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN PERPETUAL TRUSTS 163,732 PENSION PLAN CHANGE OTHER THAN NET PERIODIC BENEFIT COST 86,618 CHANGE IN CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE 1,740 ------- 747,379
